job description:
• *At Golder, we thrive on challenges.**
Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder is currently seeking a **Geologist or Environmental Scientist** for a **full-time** opportunity open at our **Greensboro office** . This individual will manage environmental projects that involve field studies, report preparation, budget management, and interaction with coworkers, clients, subcontractors, and regulators. Projects will include groundwater, surface water, soil, and air sampling; environmental site assessments; regulatory permitting; subsurface site characterizations involving drilling, soil classification, aquifer testing, and bedrock mapping; remediation; and treatment system operation, maintenance, and monitoring.
  • *Responsibilities include:**
+ The successful candidate should enjoy identifying new business opportunities and building successful client relationships.

+ Understand various regulatory environments and associated technical requirements;

+ Prepare proposals (scope, schedule, and budget);

+ Evaluate analytical data and identify, develop, and manage the remedial solutions for our clients;

+ Oversee drillers and other on-site contractors;

+ Prepare boring and well construction logs;

+ Prepare state and federal level reports and other deliverables

+ Interact with environmental agencies and clients;

+ Simultaneously manage multiple projects through all phases of development;

+ Supervise, coordinate, and review/evaluate activities carried out by junior engineers and scientists;

+ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced working environment;

+ Assist with junior staff mentoring; and

+ Build and maintain long-term relationships with key clients by providing technical expertise, attending client meetings, participating in industry events, and responding to requests for proposals.
  • *Requirements:**
+ Position requires traveland fieldwork.

+ Requires B.S. (minimum)in Geology, Environmental Science, or similar earth science,

+ Minimum of 5 yearsof environmental project experience, including project management, proposalwriting, client contact, and regulatory interaction.
  • *Desirable Skills:**
+ Strong computer skillsincluding Word and Excel. Specialized computer skills including databaseapplications, groundwater and contaminant modeling software, GIS, gINT, andAutoCAD;

+ Strong and effectiveverbal and written communication skills;

+ North Carolina, SouthCarolina, and Georgia regulatory experience;

+ Environmental fieldmonitoring / sampling experience using various methods and equipment(groundwater, surface water, soil, air);

+ Drilling and wellinstallation experience using various drilling methods;

+ Treatment systemoperation, maintenance, and monitoring experience;

+ Leadership ability witha positive attitude;

+ Ability to workindependently and within groups;

+ 40-hour OSHA HAZWOPERhealth and safety training
  • *Preferred:**
+ North Carolina PG orequivalent license preferred.
